reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: TPC: INL/Nigeria, Police and Peacekeeping Advisor. Other Services - Contract Advisory and Assistance Service Individual Experts and Consultants. Information has been Redacted in accordance with the two principled exceptions of the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act (FATAA) of 2016; including the health and security of implementing partners, as well as national interest of the United States.

description.narrative: This award strives to help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability. More specifically, this includes Award Description - TPC: INL/Nigeria, Police and Peacekeeping Advisor Information Redacted. TPC: INL/Nigeria, Police and Peacekeeping Advisor Information Redacted [Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505.]. BPA Call modification to exercise Option Year 01 with a new PoP of 07/01/2019 - 06/30/2020 for $259,020.36 for a Police and Peacekeeping Advisor in INL/Nigeria.. Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505.. TPC: INL/Nigeria, Police and Peacekeeping Information Redacted[Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505.]. NIGERIA : Covers individual experts and consultants possessing special, current knowledge, and skill which may be combined with extensive operational experience. They provide information, opinions, advice, or recommendations that enhance understanding of complex issues or improve the quality and timeliness of policy development and decision-making. Contract experts and consultants do not supervise or perform operating functions nor do they receive direct supervision. Contract experts and consultants serving on advisory committees are to be assigned to subobject code 2505..

To help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability; and for responding effectively against arising threats to national or international security and stability.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The primary goal of U.S. assistance in Nigeria is to support the country's development as a stable democracy while reducing extreme poverty. In the North East region, where the violent Boko Haram insurgency has devastated local populations, the U.S. government will continue to provide life-saving humanitarian assistance and transitional programs for stabilization. Targeted U.S. foreign assistance in Nigeria seeks to reduce extreme poverty and improve the quality of life for Nigeria's most vulnerable communities through improved governance at the federal, state, and local levels; reduced corruption; a strengthened private sector as a source of job creation; and improved quality of social service delivery. U.S. assistance will continue to address security issues by increasing the skills of security forces and advocating for institutional reform. Additionally, U.S. assistance will better position Nigeria to achieve its goal of regional leadership in West Africa via the Abuja-based Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) regional commission, while advancing U.S. policy objectives.
Information Redacted

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Peace and Security - General
